Subject: NullPointerException (using AdaptiveRevisitFrontier and DeDuplicator)

Hi,

I'm new to heritrix. 

I'm trying to set up a continuous crawl, using the
AdaptiveRevisitFrontier as well as the
is.hi.bok.deduplicator.DeDupFetchHTTP and
is.hi.bok.deduplicator.DeDuplicator Fetchers.

When I set up a job, all goes well for the first few
minutes. But then the jobs always seem to halt, usually
before 1000 documents have been retrieved.

When I check the console, the job always generates an
alert from a NullPointerException (see below).

The progress-statistics.log continues being written to
periodically, but the numbers never change (except for
that the memory usage fluctuates slightly).

Any idea of what's wrong? Is the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier
just too experimental? Or could the DeDuplicator plugin
be causing me trouble? 

Thanks,
-Colin.

----------------------------------------------------

Time:        Jan. 21, 2008 23:23:27 GMT
Level:      SEVERE
Message:    

Fatal exception in ToeThread #19:  (in thread 'ToeThread #19: ')

Exception:      

java.lang.NullPointerException
Stacktrace: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:285)
    at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:151)
